text: Jórvík was the Viking name for the English city of York and the kingdom centred there. York had been founded as the Roman legionary fortress of Eboracum and revived as the Anglo-Saxon trading port of Eoforwic. It was first captured in November 866 by a large army of Danish Vikings. == Other websites == * Brenda Ralph Lewis & David Nash Ford, "York: Viking Times" *Timeline of Anglo-Saxon England * Jorvik Viking Centre * York Archaeological Trust * Welcome to Jorvik : links on on-line resources Category:9th century in England Category:York
title: Jorvik
